Note: In the original paragraph, "polymer" and "PCBM" can be considered as materials, but since the paragraph is specifically asking for material properties, these entities are already included in the context of the discussion and do not need to be explicitly listed as properties.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: This might be attributed to the smaller LUMO offset or less ideal mixing morphology between the polymer and PCBM.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value            |
|--------------------------|
| smaller LUMO offset      |
| less ideal mixing morphology |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value            |
|--------------------------|
| smaller LUMO offset      |
| less ideal mixing morphology |

Note: LUMO stands for "Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital", which is a material property related to the electronic structure of a material. The smaller the LUMO offset, the easier it is for electrons to move from the polymer to PCBM (Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl):[6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester), leading to better charge transfer and potentially better performance in organic solar cells. The mixing morphology refers to the distribution and intermingling of the two materials (polymer and PCBM) at the nanoscale level, which can affect the efficiency of charge transfer and thus the overall performance of the solar cell.
